channel.title: UTorrent
channel.description:
Imo this is the best BitTorrent Client that I have ever used. I used to stay faithful to BitTornado, it never let me down but then I tried this new Client out and it blew me away, It's quite rare in my life for something to have such an effect on me. I use WLAN and leech off my neighbor so I usually got 5kbps per sec in BitTornado, but when I switched to UTorrent the damn thing started giving me an average speed of 45kbps on a Wireless Network! I managed to download many seasons of Simpsons, PSP Games a total of around 7 gig in less than a week. (What I'm basically worried about is that if I go over the dude's bandwith limit he might get suspicious and add a Network Key...But until then!! :DD)
Reasons why you should use UTorrent Client:
[ul][li]Enabling Encryption Option- Most ISP's these days throttle your speed limit for bandwith purposes, this enables encrypted data so that your ISP cannot find out you are doing BT related activities so you get all the speed[/li]
[li]Search Engine-It is inbuilt right into the console so it makes it for easy searching and dling[/li]
[li]Force Start-When you download a torrent and right click it, it says force start. This is for times when your torrent gets queued, enabling this forces your torrent to download :)[/li]
[li]File Choosing-Say you download a torrent file, for example I dled Simpsons Episode 1803, some torrents download in parts each one having a size of like 14mb and when ripped it rips the files from all the rars, sometimes one of the rars are corrupt therefore you cannot unrar it. UTorrent solves this by showing a checklist of all the files so you can uncheck all the files except Simpsons Episode 1803. part 11 so that you only need to dl the corrupted file and don't need to dl the whole thing over again :D[/li]
[li]Online downloader-If you are one of those careful types wondering if this is a virus of some sort UTorrent solved that too by having an online client which does not require harddrive installation, its called a Standalone and scroll down to my Sig to go to the UTorrent download page and use it[/li][/ul]
These are just some of the great features and there are tons more for more experienced users, guides for making the most out of UTorrent: [url=http://www.utorrent.com/guides.php]Guides[/url]
Enjoy! ;)
~ VG_Kobra

item.title: UTorrent
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I used to use µtorrent, but after trying Azureus I noticed that my dl speeds where faster, so no i us that. But it can also depend on the file I whas dl’ing.

Read full topic

item.title: UTorrent
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I use this to.

I’m now up to my 45th movie that I downloaded with it. I’ve only watched like… 3 of them

It’s gonna take forever to burn them all onto dvd’s.

Read full topic

I dont suppose it matters, everyone knows what he means

item.title: UTorrent
item.dc:creator: @VG_Kobra VG_Kobra
item.description:
@VG_Kobra wrote:

ilyaostr9:

it’s µTorrent not uTorrent

No really? Thanks for telling me, I didn’t get it the first 2 times people have said it in this thread :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: UTorrent
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

it’s µTorrent not uTorrent

Read full topic

item.title: UTorrent
item.dc:creator: @Oh_chappy Oh chappy
item.description:
@Oh_chappy wrote:

how the heck do you get to be a comunity member. yesterady i saw oen with 11 posts

Read full topic

item.title: UTorrent
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

yea µ (Mu) is the scientific prefix meaning micro is meant to reflect on the client’s size

µTorrent is ok, but I also use Azureus ;D

Read full topic

item.title: UTorrent
item.dc:creator: @VG_Kobra VG_Kobra
item.description:
@VG_Kobra wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:2, topic:18886”]omg omg you spelt the U in µTorrent wrong!!! It’s a µ (alt 0181) lol.

Nice review. µTorrent owns.

Don’t forget how small it is on the task manager. I remember when I used BitTorrent and it took up 60k of my resources. This app only takes like 1 - 4k. So that’s probably why you have a faster speed too, it’s not all bulked up, and spends more time getting more seeders/downloaders than doing other crap!

There is a list of like 40 other features, I’m too lazy to get the list though. Nice job. :)[/quote]

Omg I just realized that too!
[me=VG_Kobra]goes and stabs himself[/me]

Lol yea as I mentioned there are tons of features but only for the experienced users. It really is the best BT Client out there

Read full topic

item.title: UTorrent
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

omg omg you spelt the U in µTorrent wrong!!! It’s a µ (alt 0181) lol.

Nice review. µTorrent owns.

Don’t forget how small it is on the task manager. I remember when I used BitTorrent and it took up 60k of my resources. This app only takes like 1 - 4k. So that’s probably why you have a faster speed too, it’s not all bulked up, and spends more time getting more seeders/downloaders than doing other crap!

There is a list of like 40 other features, I’m too lazy to get the list though. Nice job.

Read full topic
